bib.title: -Application Of A Resonance Capture Detector To The Precise Measurement Of Neutron Total Cross Sections.

free_txt: THE 46 MEV ELECTRON LINAC AT THE
RESEARCH REACTOR INSTITUTE OF KYOTO UNIVERSITY, OPERA-
TED AT A FREQUENCY OF 300 PULSES/SEC AND WITH A PULSE
WIDTH OF 68 NS, ELECTRON ENERGY 32 MEV AND PEAK
CURRENT 2 A.
S.W.
.THE DATA WERE CORRECTED FOR DEAD-TIME LOSSES AND BACK-
GROUND.
A RESONANCE CAPTURE DETECTOR CONSISTING OF 8
PIECES OF BI4-GE3-O12 (BGO) CRYSTAL SCINTILLATOR AND
A CAPTURE SAMPLE OF TA. THE CRYSTALS, 5 X 5 CM SQUARE
AND 7.5 CM THICK, WERE ASSEMBLED INTO A BANK LEAVING A
THROUGH HOLE 2.7 X 2.7 CM SQUARE, THE INSIDE OF WHICH
WAS COATED  WITH 3 MM THICK ENRICHED 6-LIF TILES. THE
TA CAPTURE SAMPLE WAS A 1.8 X 1.8 CM SQUARE PLATE,
1 MM THICK, PLACED AT THE CENTRE OF THE BGO HOLE. THE
BGO CRYSTALS ARE A TOTAL ABSORPTION DETECTOR IN THE
MEASUREMENT OF CAPTURE GAMMAS, AND THUS THE RESONANCE
DETECTOR IS SENSITIVE ESPECIALLY TO NEUTRONS AT THE
RESONANCE ENERGIES OF THE TA(N,G) REACTION. THE BACK-
GROUND LEVEL WAS DETERMINED USING A TA SAMPLE ALSO IN
THE TOF BEAM, A SO-CALLED SELF-INDICATION MEASUREMENT,
AND VERIFIED WITH NOTCH FILTERS SUCH AS AG AND CO.
.DETECTOR PERFORMACE WAS CHECKED BY MAKING NEUTRON
TRANSMISSION MEASUREMENTS WITH POLYETHYLENE, THE
RESULTS SHOWING VERY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH ENDF/B-IV.
.THIS RESONANCE CAPTURE DETECTOR HAS ALSO BEEN USED TO
MEASURE THE TOTAL SB CROSS SECTION, SEE EXFOR
A BF3 PROPORTIONAL COUNTER MONITORED NEUTRON
INTENSITY DURING THE EXPERIMENT.
THE ERRORS GIVEN CONTAIN BOTH STATISTICAL
AND SYSTEMATIC CONTRIBUTIONS. UNCERTAINTIES ARE DUE
MAINLY TO THE TRANSMISSION RATE STATISTICS AND THE
SAMPLE THICKNESS.
THE 46 MEV ELECTRON LINAC AT THE
RESEARCH REACTOR INSTITUTE OF KYOTO UNIVERSITY, OPERA-
TED AT A FREQUENCY OF 300 PULSES/SEC AND WITH A PULSE
WIDTH OF 68 NS, ELECTRON ENERGY 32 MEV AND PEAK
CURRENT 2 A.
BURSTS OF NEUTRONS WERE PRODUCED FROM THE
WATER-COOLED PHOTONEUTRON TARGET, WHICH WERE MADE OF
SEVERAL SHEETS OF TA PLATES, 5 CM BY 5 CM SQUARE WITH
AN EFFECTIVE TOTAL THICKNESS OF ABOUT 3.5 CM. THE TAR-
GET WAS PLACED IN THE CENTER OF AN OCTAGONAL WATER
TANK, 30 CM IN DIAMETER AND 10 CM THICK, TO MODERATE
THE NEUTRONS. A 7 CM DIAMETER BY 20 CM LONG PB BLOCK
WAS PLACED IN THE FLIGHT PATH IN FRONT OF THE TARGET
TO SUPPRESS THE PROMPT GAMMA-FLASH. THE NEUTRON BEAM
WAS AT AN ANGLE OF 135 DEG TO THE LINAC BEAM AND WAS
REDUCED TO 2 CM DIAMETER AT THE DETECTOR POSITION
USING B4C, LI2CO3 AND PB COLLIMATORS. A 0.5 MM THICK
CD FILTER WAS PLACED IN THE NEUTRON BEAM TO SUPPRESS
OVERLAP OF THERMAL NEUTRONS FROM PREVIOUS PULSES.
TIME-OF-FLIGHT TRANSMISSION MEASUREMENT WITH A
FLIGHT PATH 12.7 M.
.THREE TRANSMISSION SAMPLES IN THE FORM OF METALLIC PB
PLATES, EACH 5 X 5 CM SQUARE AND 0.5 CM THICK, PURITY
99.9993%, THE SAMPLE THICKNESSES BEING 0.09858,
0.13152 AND 0.16478 ATOMS/BARN. THE SAMPLES WERE
LOCATED ABOUT 10 M FROM THE TA TARGET.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REF.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REF.
